items.name: Character
items.description: These variables are used to access your character's information.

invocations.description: Returns your character's name.
invocations.ex: cast('exura sio "' .. $name)
invocations.exDescription: Will cast 'heal friend', using your name.

invocations.description: Returns your current world name.
invocations.ex: print($worldname)
invocations.exDescription: Will print on the console the name of the world you're currently playing at.

invocations.description: Returns your character's vocation. It can either be: 'none', 'no-vocation', 'knight', 'paladin', 'sorcerer' or 'druid'.
invocations.ex:
if $vocation == 'druid' then
	cast('exura sio "' .. $name) wait(300, 500)
elseif $vocation == 'sorcerer' then
	cast('exura vita') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Will cast 'heal friend' on yourself if you are a 'druid'. And 'ultimate healing' if you are a 'sorcerer'.

invocations.description: Returns your character's vocation abbreviated to a short way. It can either be: 'NV', 'K', 'P', 'S' or 'D'.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
listas($vocshort)
invocations.exDescription: Will show your vocation abbreviated.

invocations.description: Returns your character's vocation flags. None: 0; No-Vocation: 1; Knight: 2; Paladin: 4; Sorcerer: 8; Druid: 16.
invocations.ex:
if $voc == 2 then
	cast('exura ico') wait(300, 500)
elseif $voc == 2 then
	cast('exura') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Will cast 'wound cleansing' spell if you are a 'knight'. And 'light healing' spell if you are a 'paladin'.

invocations.description: Returns your character's id.
invocations.ex:
foreach creature m 's' do
	if m.id != $id then
		print(m.name)
	end
end
invocations.exDescription: Will print on console the name of every creature on your screen, except yourself.

invocations.description: Returns your character's current health.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $hp < 50 then
	cast('exura') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if your health is below 50. If it is, it will cast 'light healing' spell.

invocations.description: Returns your character's maximum health.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $maxhp-$hp > 120 then
	cast('exura gran') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you have more than 60 hit points missing. If it is, it will cast 'intense healing' spell.

invocations.description: Returns your character's health percentage.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $hppc < 60 then
	cast('exura san') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you have less than 60% of health. If so, it will cast 'divine healing' spell.

invocations.description: Returns your character's current mana.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $hp < 50 and $mp >= 20 then
	cast('exura') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if your health is below 50 and your mana above 20. If it is, it will cast 'light healing' spell.

invocations.description: Returns your character's maximum mana.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $maxmp-$mp < 4 then
	cast('utevo lux') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if your mana is close to full mana. If so, it will cast 'light' spell.

invocations.description: Returns your character's mana percentage.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $mppc < 60 then
	useoncreature('great mana potion', $self) wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you have less than 60% of mana. If so, it will use a 'great mana potion' on yourself.

invocations.description: Returns your character's soul points.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $mp >= 400 and $soul >= 4 then
	cast('adura vita') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you have mora than 400 of mana, and more than 4 soul points. If so, it will make an 'ultimate healing rune'.

invocations.description: Returns your character's current capacity.
invocations.ex:
if $cap < 20 then
	gotolabel('godeposit')
end
invocations.exDescription: This action script will check if your cap is lower than 20.00oz. If so, it will go to label 'godeposit'.

invocations.description: Returns your character's current experience.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $exp >= 4200 then
	closeclient()
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you have more than 4200 of experience. If so, it will close the client.

invocations.description: Returns your character's offline training time in minutes.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $offlinetraining >= 10*60 then
	playsound('monster.wav')
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you have more than 10 hours offline training. If so, it will play an alarm.

invocations.description: Returns your character's stamina in minutes.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $stamina < 15*60 then
	closeclient()
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you have less than 15 hours left of stamina. If so, it will close the client.

invocations.description: Returns true if you're currently mounting an animal, false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
auto(1000, 2500)
if not ($inpz or $mounted) then 
	mount()
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 1000~2500 milliseconds, it will check you are not inside a protection zone and not mounted. If so, it will mount on the last mounted animal.

invocations.description: Returns your character's position x.
Returns your character's position y.
Returns your character's position z.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $posx == 33222 and $posy == 33222 and $posz == 7 then
	playsound('monster.wav')
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if your position is equals to x:33222, y:33222, z:7. If so, it will play an alert with file name: 'monster.wav'

items.name: Skills
items.description: These variables are used to access your character's skills.

invocations.description: Returns your character's current level.
invocations.ex:
init start
	local curLevel = $level
init end
auto(200)
if $level > curLevel then
	screenshot()
	curLevel = $level
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you leveled up. If so, it will take a screenshot.

invocations.description: Returns your character's magic level.
Returns your character's fist fighting skill.
Returns your character's club fighting skill.
Returns your character's sword fighting skill.
Returns your character's axe fighting skill.
Returns your character's distance fighting skill.
Returns your character's shielding skill.
Returns your character's fishing skill.
Returns the percentage learnt of your character's level.
Returns the percentage learnt of your character's magic level.
Returns the percentage learnt of your fist fighting skill.
Returns the percentage learnt of your character's club fighting skill.
Returns the percentage learnt of your character's sword fighting skill.
Returns the percentage learnt of your character's axe fighting skill.
Returns the percentage learnt of your character's distance fighting skill.
Returns the percentage learnt of your character's shielding skill.
Returns the percentage learnt of your character's fishing skill.

items.name: Status Effects
items.description: These variables are used to access your character's status effects.

invocations.description: Returns true if your character is battle signed, false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if not $battlesigned then
	logout()
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you are battle signed. If not, it will cast logout.

invocations.description: Returns true if your character is bleeding, false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $bleeding and (vocation == 'knight' or vocation == 'druid') then
	cast('exana kor')
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you are bleeding, and you are a 'knight' or a 'druid'. If so, it will cast 'cure bleeding' spell.

invocations.description: Returns the value of the last physical damage you have taken. When your bleeding stats goes out, this value is set to zero.
Returns true if your character is burning, false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $burning and $mp >= 30 and $vocation == 'druid' then
	cast('exana flam') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you are burning, and you're a 'druid' and you have more than 30 of mana. If so, it will cast 'cure burning' spell.

invocations.description: Returns the value of the last fire damage you have taken. When your burning stats goes out, this value is set to zero.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $burningdmg >= 3 and $burningdmg <= 10 and $burning and $vocation == 'druid' then
	cast('exana flam') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you're burning, and the last fire damage that you have taken. If you are burning, you're a 'druid', and the damage taken is between 3 and 10 (which could mean you're soul fired), it will cast 'cure burning' spell.

invocations.description: Returns true if your character is cursed, false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $cursed and $vocation == 'paladin' then
	cast('exana mort') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you are cursed and you are a 'paladin'. If so, it cast 'cure curse' spell.

invocations.description: Returns the value of the last death damage you have taken. When your cursed stats goes out, this value is set to zero.
Returns true if your character is dazzled, false otherwise.
Returns true if your character is drowning (underwater), false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $drowning then
	equipitem('helmet of the deep', 'head')
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you are drowning. If so, it will equip your character with a 'helmet of the deep'.

invocations.description: Returns true if your character is drunk, false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $drunk then
	equipitem('dwarven ring', 'finger') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you are drunk. If so, it will equip your character with a 'dwarven ring'.

invocations.description: Returns true if your character is burning, false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $electrified and $mp >= 30 and $vocation == 'druid' then
	cast('exana vis') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you are burning, and you're a 'druid' and you have more than 30 of mana. If so, it will cast 'cure electrification' spell.

invocations.description: Returns the value of the last energy damage you have taken. When your electrified stats goes out, this value is set to zero.
Returns true if your character is frozen, false otherwise.
Returns the value of the last ice damage you have taken. When your ice stats goes out, this value is set to zero.
Returns true if your character is hasted, false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if not $hasted then
	cast('utani hur') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you are hasted. If not, it will cast 'haste' spell.

invocations.description: Returns true if your character is protected by mana shield, false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if not $manashielded then
	cast('utamo vita') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you are mana shielded. If not, it will cast 'magic shield' spell.

invocations.description: Returns true if your character is paralyzed, false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $paralyzed then
	cast('exura') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you are paralyzed. If so, it will cast 'light healing' spell.

invocations.description: Returns true if your character is poisoned, false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $poisoned and $mp >= 30 then
	cast('exana pox') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you are poisoned and you have more than 30 of mana. If so, it will cast 'antidote' spell.

invocations.description: Returns the value of the last poison damage you have taken. When your poison stats goes out, this value is set to zero.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $poisondmg > 15 and $poisoned then
	cast('exana pox') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you're poisoned, and the last poison damage that you have taken. If you are poisoned, and the damage was higher than 15, it will cast 'antidote' spell.

invocations.description: Returns true if your character is in a pvp battle, false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $pvpsigned then
	playsound('playeronscreen.wav')
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you are in a pvp battle (attacked someone). If so, it will play an alarm.

invocations.description: Returns true if your character is inside a protection zone, false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $pzone then
	closeclient()
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you are inside a protection zone. If so, it will close the client.

invocations.description: Returns true if your character is strenghtened, false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if not $strenghtened then
	cast('utito tempo') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you are strengthened. If not, it cast 'blood rage' spell.

items.name: Damage
items.description: These variables are used to tell you information about the damage you've taken. They're all based on the damage animation that appears high above your character after receiving a damage.

invocations.description: Returns the value of the last death damage you have taken.
Returns the value of the last poison damage you have taken.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $earthdmg > 15 and $poisoned then
	cast('exana pox') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you're poisoned, and the last poison damage that you have taken. If you are poisoned, and the damage was higher than 15, it will cast 'antidote' spell.

invocations.description: Returns the value of the last energy damage you have taken.
Returns the value of the last fire damage you have taken.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $firedmg >= 3 and $firedmg <= 10 and $burning and $vocation == 'druid' then
	cast('exana flam') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Each 200 milliseconds, it will check if you're burning, and the last fire damage that you have taken. If you are burning, you're a 'druid', and the damage taken is between 3 and 10 (which could mean you're soul fired), it will cast 'cure burning' spell.

invocations.description: Returns the value of the last healing animation that happened above your character.
Returns the value of the last ice damage you have taken.
Returns the value of the last holy damage you have taken.
Returns the value of the last damage that you have taken on your mana shield.
Returns the value of the last physical damage you have taken.

items.name: Timer
items.description: These variables are used to access the bot's timers.

invocations.description: Returns the time in milliseconds remaining on the haste spell.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $hastetime <= 2000 then
	cast('utani gran hur') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Will cast 'strong haste' spell if you have less than 2 seconds left of haste.

invocations.description: Returns the time in milliseconds remaining on the invisibility spell.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $invistime <= 2000 then
	cast('utana vid') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Will cast 'invisibility' spell if you have less than 2 seconds left of invisibility.

invocations.description: Returns the time in milliseconds remaining on the magic shield spell.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $mshieldtime <= 2000 then
	cast('utamo vita') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Will cast 'magic shield' spell if you have less than 2 seconds left of magic shield.

invocations.description: Returns the time in milliseconds remaining on the strenghten spell.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $strenghtentime <= 2000 then
	cast('utito tempo san') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Will cast 'sharpshooter' spell if you have less than 2 seconds left of strength.

items.name: Equipment
items.description: These variables are used to access your character's equipment slots.

invocations.description: Returns the item in your neck slot. If you need more info about the item data structure, access this.
invocations.ex:
auto(1000)
if $neck.id ~= 3057 then
	printerror('Be careful! You're not wearing an 'amulet of loss'.')
end
invocations.exDescription: Will print an error message warning you if you're not wearing an 'amulet of loss'.

invocations.description: Returns the item in your head slot. If you need more info about the item data structure, access this.
Returns the item in your back slot. If you need more info about the item data structure, access this.
Returns the item in your right hand slot. If you need more info about the item data structure, access this.
Returns the item in your chest slot. If you need more info about the item data structure, access this.
Returns the item in your left hand slot. If you need more info about the item data structure, access this.
Returns the item in your legs slot. If you need more info about the item data structure, access this.
Returns the item in your finger slot. If you need more info about the item data structure, access this.
Returns the item in your feet slot. If you need more info about the item data structure, access this.
Returns the item in your belt slot. If you need more info about the item data structure, access this.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $belt.count < 10 then
	equipitem($belt.id, 'belt') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Will refill your ammo if you have less than 10 units on the belt slot.

items.name: Creature
items.description: These variables are used to access creature information.

invocations.description: Returns your character's creature. If you need more info about the creature data structure, access this.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $self.lightintensity == 0 then
	cast('utevo gran lux') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Will cast 'great light' spell if you're not emitting any light.

invocations.description: Returns the current attacked creature (the one with a red square). If you need more info about the creature data structure, access this.
invocations.ex:
if $attacked.id ~= 0 and $attacked.isshootable then
	cast('exori flam') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Will cast 'flame strike' spell if you're currently attacking a target, and it is shootable.

invocations.description: Returns the current followed creature (the one with a green square). If you need more info about the creature data structure, access this.
invocations.ex:
if $followed.id == 0 then
	follow('Bubble') wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Will follow the character 'Bubble' if you are not currently following anyone.

invocations.description: Returns the creature that you have last attacked. If you need more info about the creature data structure, access this.
invocations.ex: attack($target)
invocations.exDescription: Will attack the last creature you have attacked.

invocations.description: Returns the creature being targetted by the Targeting System. If you need more info about the creature data structure, access this.
invocations.ex:
if $targetingtarget.id ~= 0 and $targetingtarget.isshootable then
	useoncreature('sudden death rune', $targetingtarget) wait(300, 500)
end
invocations.exDescription: Will shoot a 'sudden death rune' on the targeting creature.

invocations.description: Returns the monster that has last attacked you within 3 seconds. If you need more info about the creature data structure, access this.
invocations.ex:
auto(200) if $mattacker.id ~= 0 then
	playsound('monster.wav') wait(3000)
end
invocations.exDescription: Will play an alarm if a monster attacked you in the last 3 seconds.

invocations.description: Returns the player that has last attacked you within 3 seconds. If you need more info about the creature data structure, access this.
invocations.ex:
auto(200) if $pattacker.id ~= 0 then
	print($pattacker.name .. ' is attacking you!')
	playsound('monster.wav') wait(3000)
end
invocations.exDescription: Will play an alarm if a player attacked you in the last 3 seconds, and will print his name on the console.

items.name: Screen Information
items.description: These variables are used to access information about the game screen, such as messages, effects, projectiles and animated texts.

invocations.description: Returns the data structure of the latest message received in the client. If you need more info about the message data structure, access this.
invocations.ex:
auto(100)
if $lastmsg.content == 'heal me please' and $lastmsg.sender == 'Bubble' then
	cast('exura sio "bubble')
end
invocations.exDescription: Will cast 'heal friend' on Bubble if she asks: 'heal me please'.

invocations.description: Returns the data structure of the latest NPC message received in the client. If you need more info about the message data structure, access this.
invocations.ex:
auto(100)
if $lastnpcmsg.content == 'You don't have enough money.' then
	setsetting('Cavebot/Enabled', 'no')
end
invocations.exDescription: Will disable cavebot if you get a "You don't have enough money" message from a NPC.

invocations.description: Returns the data structure of the latest projectile received in the client. If you need more info about the projectile data structure, access this.
invocations.ex:
auto(100)
if $lastprojectile.tox == $attacked.posx and $lastprojectile.toy == $attacked.posy and $lastprojectile.fromx == $posx and $lastprojectile.fromy == $posy then
	cast('exori vis')
end
invocations.exDescription: Will cast 'energy strike' on the current attacked creature right after a projectile was shot from you in the direction of your target. Useful to synchronize wands and spell attacks, and to avoid getting skulls by casting spells at another players.

invocations.description: Returns the data structure of the latest effect received in the client. If you need more info about the effect data structure, access this.
invocations.ex:
auto(100)
if $lasteffect.type == 3 and $lasteffect.posx == $attacked.posx and $lasteffect.posy == $attacked.posy then
	playsound('monster.wav')
end
invocations.exDescription: Will play a sound if the last effect was 'poff' at the current attacked creature's location.

invocations.description: Returns the data structure of the latest animated text received in the client. If you need more info about the animated text data structure, access this.
invocations.ex:
auto(100)
if $lastanimatedtext.color == 155 and $lastanimatedtext.posx == $posx and $lastanimatedtext.posy == $posy then
	print($lastanimatedtext.content)
end
invocations.exDescription: Will print on the console the content of the last animated text, if that text has the same color as 'energy damages' and happens above your character.

items.name: Client Information
items.description: These variables are used to access information about the client.

invocations.description: Returns true if you are connected to the game world, false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
auto(1000) if not $connected then
	playsound('disconnected.wav')
end
invocations.exDescription: Will play an alarm if your character is disconnected.

invocations.description: Returns your current attack mode. It can be 'defensive', 'balanced' and 'offensive'.
invocations.ex:
auto(2000) if $attackmode ~= 'offensive' then
	setattackmode('offensive', $chasemode) wait(1000)
end
invocations.exDescription: Will set the attack mode to offensive if it's not offensive yet.

invocations.description: Returns your current chase mode. It can be 'stand' and 'chase'.
Returns your current pvp mode. It can be 'dove', 'white', 'yellow' and 'red'.
Returns your current pvp security mode. It can be 'secure' and 'normal'.
Returns true if the 'battle window' is open, false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
auto(500) if not $battleopen then
openbattlelist() wait(1000)
end
invocations.exDescription: Will automatically open the battle window if it's closed.

invocations.description: Returns true if the 'trade window' is open, false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
if not $tradeopen then
	say('hi') wait(1700, 2300)
	npcsay('trade') wait(500, 1000)
end
invocations.exDescription: Used as an action waypoint. Will check if the trade window is open. If it's not, say: 'hi', wait some time for the NPC channel to be open, then say 'trade'.

invocations.description: Returns true if the Tibia Client is minimized, false otherwise.
Returns true if the Tibia Client is the window currently focused, false otherwise.
Returns the currently typed text in the chat window.
Returns the currently written text in the 'Edit text' window.
invocations.ex:
if $writtentext != 'Bubble\nVenore' then
	printerror('The label destination is wrong!')
end
invocations.exDescription: Will print an error if the label destination isn't written to 'Bubble', at 'Venore'. NOTE: new lines are indicated by the characters '\n'.

invocations.description: Returns the author and message date in the currently open 'Edit text' window. The information is separated by colons (':').
Returns the name of the currently open menu/window. If it's a context menu (with options like Attack/Use/Open etc), it will return 'Context'.

items.name: Statistics
items.description: These variables are used to access some bot statistics, such as experience rates, or time to next level.

invocations.description: Returns the experience rate you're currently doing. It's the same value shown in your skill window.
invocations.ex:
setposition(200, 200)
drawtext('Exp/Hour: ' .. $exphour, 0, 0)
invocations.exDescription: Shows in a HUD how much of experience/hour you are currently making.

invocations.description: Returns how much of experience you have gained since the bot started.
invocations.ex:
setposition(200, 200)
drawtext('Exp Gained: ' .. $expgained, 0, 13)
invocations.exDescription: Shows in a HUD how much of experience you have gained so far.

invocations.description: Returns how much of experience you still need to get to achieve the next level.
invocations.ex:
setposition(200, 200)
drawtext('Exp Left: ' .. $expgained, 0, 26)
invocations.exDescription: Shows in a HUD how much of experience left to the next level.

invocations.description: Returns the time left in minutes to achieve the next level, considering the current experience rate.
invocations.ex:
setposition(200, 200)
drawtext('Time To Level: ' .. time($timetonextlevel*60), 0, 39)
invocations.exDescription: Shows in a HUD how long it's gonna take to achieve the next level.

items.name: Bot State
items.description: These variables are used to access some states of the bot.

invocations.description: Returns true if the cavebot is enabled, false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
if $targeting then
	setsetting('Targeting/Enabled', 'no')
else
	setsetting('Targeting/Enabled', 'yes')
end
invocations.exDescription: Will toggle the targeting state. In other words, if the targeting is enabled, it will disable it. If it's disabled, it will enable it.

invocations.description: Returns true if the cavebot is enabled, false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
if $looting then
	setsetting('Looting/Enabled', 'no')
else
	setsetting('Looting/Enabled', 'yes')
end
invocations.exDescription: Will toggle the looting state. In other words, if the looting is enabled, it will disable it. If it's disabled, it will enable it.

invocations.description: Returns true if the cavebot is enabled, false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
if $cavebot then
	setsetting('Cavebot/Enabled', 'no')
else
	setsetting('Cavebot/Enabled', 'yes')
end
invocations.exDescription: Will toggle the cavebot state. In other words, if the cavebot is enabled, it will disable it. If it's disabled, it will enable it.

invocations.description: Returns the name of the current waypoint section.
invocations.ex:
if $wptsection == 'gotocity' and $standtime >= 10000 then
	gotolabel(0, 'hunt')
end
invocations.exDescription: If you are in the waypoint section named 'gotocity' and you are standing at the same SQM for longer than 10 seconds it will go to the first label of the section named 'hunt'.

invocations.description: Returns the current waypoint type.
Returns the current waypoint id. Keep in mind that you should also check the section to fully identify the waypoint.
invocations.ex: gotolabel($wptid-1)
invocations.exDescription: Goes to the previous waypoint.

invocations.description: Returns the current waypoint position x.
invocations.ex:
if $posx == $wptx and $posy == $posy and $posz == $wptz then
	gotolabel($wptid+1)
else
	gotolabel($wptid-1)
end
invocations.exDescription: Goes to the next waypoint if you are exactly at the waypoint's position, otherwise it goes to the previous one.

invocations.description: Returns the current waypoint position y.
Returns the current waypoint position z.
Returns the name of the last label that the cavebot has went through.
Returns the percentage of bodies that was successfully looted by the looting system.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
listas('Looting accuracy: ' .. $lootaccuracy)
invocations.exDescription: Will show the looting accuracy in a 'list as' HUD.

invocations.description: Returns how many loot bodies are around. You can use this to avoid performing some action with bodies around you.
Returns the amount of loot bodies on the looting queue.
invocations.ex:
setposition(100, 200)
drawtext('Loot Bodies: ' .. $lootbodies, 0, 0)
invocations.exDescription: A simple HUD to show how many bodies are yet to be looted.

invocations.description: Returns the last container which had space during the last moveitemsonto(...) event. To reset, after you have emptied/shuffled the relevant containers, call 'clearlastonto()'.
invocations.ex:
if $lastonto > 20 then
	clearlastonto()
end
invocations.exDescription: Clears the last onto container if the current onto index is higher than 20.

invocations.description: Returns how much money was spent already. To increase this value, check increasemoneyspent function.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
listas('Money spent: ' .. $moneyspent)
invocations.exDescription: Will show how much money you have spent in a 'list as' HUD.

invocations.description: Returns true if the open backpacks at login or open next backpack system is currently opening backpacks, false otherwise.
invocations.ex:
auto(100)
if $openingbps then
	pausewalking(1000)
end
invocations.exDescription: Will pause the cavebot walking if the bot is currently trying to open backpacks.

invocations.description: Returns true if you're currently refilling. This variable can be used to turn alerts off if you're currently going to the city, for example.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if not $refilling and paround(0) > 0 then
	playsound('playeronscreen.wav')
end
invocations.exDescription: Will play the sound 'playeronscreen.wav' only if you're not currently refilling and there are players around you.

invocations.description: Returns the last bank balance amount reported by an NPC.
invocations.ex:
if $balance >= 2000 then
	npcsay('withdraw' .. 2000)
else
	setsetting('Cavebot/Enabled', 'no')
	setsetting('Targeting/Enabled', 'no')
end
invocations.exDescription: Disables the cavebot and targeting if you don't have more than 2000 of gold on your account. If you do have it, it will withdraw these 2000 gold pieces.

invocations.description: Returns true if the targeting system is trapped, false otherwise. Note: currently, the targeting system must be running for it to work.
invocations.ex:
auto(100)
if $trapped then
	playsound('monster.wav')
end
invocations.exDescription: Will play an alarm if you are currently trapped.

invocations.description: Returns a table containing the name and type of the current script.
invocations.ex: print($curscript.name)
invocations.exDescription: Will print the name of the current script on the console.

items.name: Server Response
items.description: These variables are used to identify possible problems on the connection between you and the Tibia server. Which may be useful to warn you about lags or freezes.

invocations.description: Returns the last calculated ping value, in milliseconds.
invocations.ex:
setposition(100, 200)
drawtext('Ping: ' .. $ping, 0, 13)
invocations.exDescription: A simple HUD to show your current ping.

invocations.description: Returns the average of the last 6 obtained ping values, in milliseconds.
invocations.ex:
for i=1,4 do
	useitem('ham') wait($pingaverage*0.3, $pingaverage*0.4)
end
invocations.exDescription: Will eat 4 hams, waiting a random time based on your ping average.

invocations.description: Returns the time in milliseconds since the last packet was received from the server.
invocations.ex:
auto(100)
if $idlerecvtime >= 2500 then
	playsound('freeze.wav')
end
invocations.exDescription: Will play an alarm if the last packet was received more than 2.5 seconds ago.

items.name: Timer
items.description: These variables can be used to check the time between some actions, or how long some condition has been satisfied.

invocations.description: Returns the time in milliseconds that your character is standing at the same position.
invocations.ex:
auto(100)
if $standtime >= 30000 then
	playsound('monster.wav')
end
invocations.exDescription: Will play an alarm your character is standing at the same position for more than 30 seconds. Good to detect a broken path on your waypoint, or if someone is blocking your way.

invocations.description: Returns the time in milliseconds since the bot has started.
invocations.ex:
init start
	local timestart = $timems
init end
auto(100)
listas($timems-timestart)
invocations.exDescription: Will show how many milliseconds has passed since you started this script.

invocations.description: Returns the time in milliseconds that a menu in the client has been open.
invocations.ex:
auto(100)
if $openmenutime >= 5000 then
	playsound('monster.wav')
end
invocations.exDescription: Will play an alarm if the time since a menu is open is higher than 5 seconds.

invocations.description: Returns the time in milliseconds that the control key has been held for in the client.
Returns the time in milliseconds that the shift key has been held for in the client.
Returns the time in milliseconds that the control key was physically held for by the bot.
Returns the time in milliseconds that the shift key was physically held for by the bot.
Returns the time in milliseconds since you have been targeting the same target.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)
if $targettime > 30000 then
	playsound('monster.wav')
end
invocations.exDescription: Will play an alarm if you have been targeting the same target for over 30 seconds.

items.name: HUDs
items.description: These variables are to be used with HUDs. They return informations about the screen, so that you can position your HUDs in the desired position.

invocations.description: Returns the rectangle containing the measurements of the client window. If you need more info about the rectangle data structure, access this.
invocations.ex:
setposition($clientwin.left + 20, $clientwin.top + 10)
drawtext('Hello world!', 0, 0)
invocations.exDescription: Adds a text 20 pixels to the right of the left edge of the client window, and 10 pixels below the top edge of the client window.

invocations.description: Returns the rectangle containing the measurements of the world window. If you need more info about the rectangle data structure, access this.
invocations.ex:
setposition($worldwin.right - 200, $worldwin.bottom - 13)
drawtext('Hello world!', 0, 0)
invocations.exDescription: Adds a text 200 pixels to the left of the right edge of the world window, and 13 pixels above the bottom edge of the world window.

invocations.description: Returns the rectangle containing the measurements of the desktop window. If you need more info about the rectangle data structure, access this.
invocations.ex: print('Your resolution: ' ..$screenrect.width.. 'x' ..$screenrect.height)
invocations.exDescription: Will print your resolution on the console.

invocations.description: Returns your cursor's position. You can access it's position x and y.
invocations.ex:
setposition($cursor.x, $cursor.y)
drawtext('Here is your mouse')
invocations.exDescription: Adds a text that follow your cursor.

invocations.description: Returns information about your cursor's position. This can be used to check the item ID of items.
invocations.ex:
auto(200)

local info = $cursorinfo
listas('x: '..info.x..', y: '..info.y..', z:'..info.z..'. ID: '..info.id..' ('..info.count..')')
invocations.exDescription: Will show in a 'list as' HUD information about your cursor.

invocations.description: Returns true if your operational system is Windows XP, false otherwise. This is useful because Windows XP system doesn't allow transparent window, so you can set a color to the background of yuor HUDs.
invocations.ex:
if $windowsxp then
	setbkgcolorxp(0xFFFFFF)
end
invocations.exDescription: If you are using Windows XP, it will set the color of the background of the HUD to 'white'.

items.name: Events
items.description: These variables are used to keep acquire information about the input events queue.

invocations.description: Returns the id of the current running event.
Returns the type of the current running event.
Returns a table containing information about the current running event.

items.name: Navigation
items.description: These variables returns information about the Navigation System.

invocations.description: Returns true if you are currently logged in to a Navigation room, false otherwise.

items.name: Database
items.description: These variables are used to access and store information in the bot's databases.

invocations.description: Used to access the general bot database (/data/windbot.db).
Used to access the world's database (/data/worlds/yourworldname.db).
Used to access the character's database (/data/chars/yourcharname.db).
